alert.note: Alert for Charleston; Coastal Colleton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued June 04 at 3:27AM EDT until June 05 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...One to two feet of inundation above ground level possible along shorelines and tidal waterways (8.0 to 8.2 feet Mean Lower Low Water at Charleston). * WHERE...Coastal Colleton and Charleston Counties. * WHEN...This evening. * IMPACTS...Significant saltwater inundation will render numerous roads impassable. Properties may also flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High tide will occur around 9:10 PM today at Charleston. Saltwater inundation will be possible 2 to 3 hours before and after high tide. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Charleston Harbor SC MLLW Categories - Minor 7.0 ft, Moderate 7.5 ft, Major 8.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.2 ft, Moderate 1.7 ft, Major 2.2 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 04/09 AM 6.5 0.7 1.6 N/A None 04/09 PM 8.1 2.3 1.6 N/A Major 05/09 AM 6.6 0.8 1.8 N/A None 05/10 PM 7.9 2.1 1.4 N/A Moderate 06/10 AM 6.3 0.5 1.4 N/A None 06/11 PM 7.3 1.5 0.9 N/A Minor &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Visit water.weather.gov for additional water level and flood impact information.
